io.spine.server.route

Class RejectionRouting<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.route.RejectionRouting<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the entity IDs to which rejections are routed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Multicast<I,com.google.protobuf.Message,io.spine.core.RejectionContext>, RejectionRoute<I,com.google.protobuf.Message>, Route<com.google.protobuf.Message,io.spine.core.RejectionContext,java.util.Set<I>>, java.io.Serializable

    public final class RejectionRouting<I>
extends java.lang.Object
implements RejectionRoute<I,com.google.protobuf.Message>
    A routing schema used by a RejectionDispatcher for delivering rejections.

    A routing schema consists of a default route and custom routes per rejection class. When calculating a set of rejection targets, RejectionRouting would see if there is a custom route set for the type of the rejection. If not found, the default route will be applied.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • route

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> RejectionRouting<I> route(java.lang.Class<R> rejectionClass,
                                                                                               RejectionRoute<I,R> via)
                                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets a custom route for the passed rejection class.

        Such a mapping may be required when...

        • An an rejection message should be matched to more than one entity (e.g. several process managers updated in response to one rejection).
        • The type of an rejection producer ID (stored in the context) differs from the type of entity identifiers (<I>.

        If there is no specific route for the class of the passed rejection, the routing will use the default route.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the rejection message
        Parameters:
        rejectionClass - the class of rejections to route
        via - the instance of the route to be used
        Returns:
        this to allow chained calls when configuring the routing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the route for this rejection class is already set
